0730 – publish splash page and new section of site, excluding the ‘Carrying the Olympic Flame’ and ‘FAQs’ sections.
1100 – publish the withheld sections and republish a few updated pages (splash and home most likely)

Presumably:
- remove any links to those sections in the body of any published pages, e.g on the OTR home page 
- set the state of the index pages in those sections to "hide from navigation"
- check the navigation now excludes those sections (and republish as necessary)
- switch on publication to the Torch section at some point before 7.30am
- unhide the torch index page from navigation at 7.30am
- republish the games section, so that "Olympic Torch Relay" appears in section navigation
- unhide the index pages in the hidden sections sometime at 11am
- republish the torch section so that the hidden sections turn up in the OTR navigation

ps at times like these static navigation is a bit of a pain.

Updated:
- remove any links to those sections in the body of any published pages, e.g on the OTR home page 
- set the state of the index pages in those sections to "hide from navigation" 
- check the navigation now excludes those sections (and republish as necessary) 
- unhide the torch index page from navigation
- switch on publication to the Torch section at 7.30am 
- republish the games section, so that "Olympic Torch Relay" appears in section navigation 
- switch off publication to the Torch section well before 11am
- unhide the index pages in the hidden sections and republish to staging
- check it all looks ok
- switch publication to the Torch section back on at 11am
- switch on the luckit search index for the Torch section

High priority
•   Non-text Content [ref: 1.1.1] – Ensure all images have descriptive alternative text.

Hi,

I've been trying for ages to get rid of a couple of bad apostrophes in the Did You Know boxes on the Sport pages. I've tried moving them, rewriting them, rewriting the whole sentence and various other things, but to no avail.

For example, for Handball the sentence in CMS reads The ball must be made of pure leather and have a circumference of about 58 - 60cm in the men's competition. In the women's competition, the circumference is 54 - 56cm.
However, when it reaches the live site it reads The ball must be made of pure leather and have a circumference of about 58 - 60cm in the men's competition. In the women's competition, the circumference is 54 - 56cm.

The same thing is happening on the Modern Pentathlon pages.
Greek philosopher Aristotle described competitors in the Pentathlon of the ancient Games as the most 'perfect sportsmen, because in their bodies strength and speed are combined in beautiful harmony'.

I've managed to get rid of the majority of these cases, but I just can't get rid of these two whatever I do! Do you know what is causing these formatting errors, and how they can be fixed? It's getting pretty frustrating!

Thanks,

Michael

It has happened because somebody has copied the full URL of the pages into the link picker as if they were external links, e.g. http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/jobs/index.php.

Instead, they could have searched for the page to link to in the normal way. 

This can be resolved by going back into the page editor, changing the links and republishing.
Brilliant, thanks Danny

Hello Tom,

The problem is that people have entered a URL into the link picker, rather
than navigating to - and picking - the required page. I've only checked the
first of them - the Jobs link - which is linked to
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/jobs/index.php,

This means, additionally, that the "hard-coded" URL appears on the staging
page, too.
http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/get-involved/

We can possibly generate you a list of all places where URLs have been
"hard-coded" rather than "picked", although this mightn't be a simple task

Kieran

* As we havent' changed the file name itself nothing should break, but (for future reference) in terms of dependent pages (ie. ones linking to a given page), if we can, we already track the dependencies and republish any pages that will be affected by a page being renamed or moved automatically. It's the things like drop down menus that often need to be updated manually (in  case the paths are in a static Javascript file for example) and need to be checked manually when a page is renamed (or about to be renamed) it's hard to track these automatically (if we could we'd automate it as part of the normal dependency tracking code) so it's more a case of manually checking the site/section and thinking of  areas are likely to be effected.

Could I request a method by which LOCOG can provide ODA with a page on London2012 that hosts the Spectator Journey Planner (SJP) . The details of the (SJP) and the desired page layout is described in the attached document.

Firstly have you done this for any other LOCOG third party ? If so can we reuse the solution (as I have a couple of projects needing headers/footers) ?

If not is to provide navigation assets as includes;

*         I feel it is really important that we provide the ODA with an HTTP includable footer (ideally but not mandatory without the BT Logo).

*         It would be nice to provide the ODA with an includable header.

With kind regards

Kavita

Marked as High. Kavita would like this before the end of next week if at all possible. We need to get back with costs and timescales tomorrow (Friday).

Dear Kitsite

I urgently need confirmation of the solution, cost and delivery date. As based on my conversation with Danny I made some promises to the ODA.

Kavita

Hi Kavita,

Will get back to you today with the work require / times.

I have to say I think Danny slightly under estimated what is involved. On the surface it seems trivial, but firstly because those components are all core and shared across the site we need to be particular careful about adding in any conditional logic and testing it (ie. hide a search box, turn off email this page etc.). Secondly all our paths in the pages are root relative and rely on a base href tag, which means all IMG paths and HREF's will also need to be rewritten on the fly [probably via post processing we can't publish them with a full path with a http://domain]. There is also a third and even more complex issue of images in the Javascript and CSS files (which are currently static and cached by Akamai) being relative, these would also need a degree of post processing (which in the case a Javascript could be particularly tricky).

I have already broken down the steps involved, it may be that you will be happy referencing the CSS files off the server with relative paths and letting your 3rd party developers do the post processing on them.

My concern here (with a tight turnaround) is that we are particularly likely to hit issues as we go along (in the past few days while we have been thinking about it we have though of several issues that weren't immediately obvious, some outlined above).

Anyway, I'll outline what we see as involved and timescales and you can see if that will fit in with what your timings or if you think a halfway house may be a suitable approach, ie. we delivery the includes but some of the paths may need some manual cleanup in this first instance (later on we can feed what had to be cleanup manually back into the main includes outputter system when we have more time).

Jamie

Urgent. As discussed with Jamie can we get a copy of the template and assets today.

The ODA will need to build for this work.

Kavita

Will be heading over to you later today, actually we'll just host them on the live site from where you'll reference them.

Jamie

comments.value:
Hello

A few thoughts on video arising from the past week of being live on the new platform:


1.       Time required to get videos into the CMS - it does seem to take quite a while to auto-generate a page in the CMS when a video is ready in FM. Is it possible to speed this up at all? At the moment it is actually slowing us up to have to wait for a page to be generated when we could create one quite quickly ourselves.


2.       We also use the MF system to host videos for the Get Set site (most of which should not appear on london2012.com). Currently every time we create a Get Set video these are also sent across to the website as new pages. These don't publish (unless we do a global site republish) but I'm wondering if we could filter out any Get Set videos. We will assign Get Set videos to one or two specific 'channels' in MF (Get Set and Get Set Carousel) so I'm wondering if the CMS could suppress any films in those channels when polled by MF. Is this possible?


3.       We now have the option of embedding the player at a larger size. The Twofour technical team have made changes to the player so it can be embedded at various sizes so we have two options for resizing to approx. 700px:

a)      If all embedded versions that you will use are the same size: TwoFour an change the MediaFreedom embed code generator so it generates all the embed codes in the larger size from now on.

b)      If we need different sizes in different places, you can manually edit the width and height properties in the generated embed code as you need to.
I imagine option b) is our preferred one given that the size of the player in News/Blogs/Other templates is going to be 448px as currently. Can you advise so I can instruct TwoFour - then you can adapt the video template to accommodate a larger player.


4.       Re: your comment on making the player caption function more elegant, Jamie suggested a piece of work which might make the captions update the page when displayed (effectively removing the white bar). I'm happy to follow this up with TwoFour but could you provide more information about how this would work?


5.       Do you have an update on making the home page lighbox/carousel work using the multi-programme view of the video?


6.       Plus the outstanding bug with videos being deleted from the CMS when we make a change to them in MF, which you are already investigating.

Morag

> 1. Time required to get videos into the CMS – it does seem to take quite a while to auto-generate a page in the CMS when a video is ready in FM. Is it possible to speed this up at all? At the moment it is actually slowing us up to have to wait for a page to be generated when we could create one quite quickly ourselves.

Done, now runs every 2 mins

> 2. We also use the MF system to host videos for the Get Set site (most of which should not appear on london2012.com). Currently every time we create a Get Set video these are also sent across to the website as new pages. These don’t publish (unless we do a global site republish) but I’m wondering if we could filter out any Get Set videos. We will assign Get Set videos to one or two specific ‘channels’ in MF (Get Set and Get Set Carousel) so I’m wondering if the CMS could suppress any films in those channels when polled by MF. Is this possible?

The ideal solution here would be for for TwoFour to add a 'don't send to CMS' flag to the videos in MediaFreedom and then for them to not poll us with those videos.

If they shouldn't be in the CMS then the most sensible / safest / cleanest thing is for TwoFour not to send them to us.

The problem with us checking things like channels is that we'll have to check the video to find out that it shouldn't have been sent to us, in fact I am not sure we can see the channel via the existing API call we are using so we may have to make an extra API call for every video.

Kitsite -> this week

> 6. Plus the outstanding bug with videos being deleted from the CMS when we make a change to them in MF, which you are already investigating.

See my other email, this is due to TwoFour sending a delete followed by a create call, rather than a single update call.

* the mix of delete + create *rather than a single update call) causes problems as it causes the expiration and republication of the video page and other dependent pages each time it happens.

Jamie

subject: FW: More video!
description:
Hello

A few thoughts on video arising from the past week of being live on the new platform:


1.       Time required to get videos into the CMS - it does seem to take quite a while to auto-generate a page in the CMS when a video is ready in FM. Is it possible to speed this up at all? At the moment it is actually slowing us up to have to wait for a page to be generated when we could create one quite quickly ourselves.


2.       We also use the MF system to host videos for the Get Set site (most of which should not appear on london2012.com). Currently every time we create a Get Set video these are also sent across to the website as new pages. These don't publish (unless we do a global site republish) but I'm wondering if we could filter out any Get Set videos. We will assign Get Set videos to one or two specific 'channels' in MF (Get Set and Get Set Carousel) so I'm wondering if the CMS could suppress any films in those channels when polled by MF. Is this possible?


3.       We now have the option of embedding the player at a larger size. The Twofour technical team have made changes to the player so it can be embedded at various sizes so we have two options for resizing to approx. 700px:

a)      If all embedded versions that you will use are the same size: TwoFour an change the MediaFreedom embed code generator so it generates all the embed codes in the larger size from now on.

b)      If we need different sizes in different places, you can manually edit the width and height properties in the generated embed code as you need to.
I imagine option b) is our preferred one given that the size of the player in News/Blogs/Other templates is going to be 448px as currently. Can you advise so I can instruct TwoFour - then you can adapt the video template to accommodate a larger player.


4.       Re: your comment on making the player caption function more elegant, Jamie suggested a piece of work which might make the captions update the page when displayed (effectively removing the white bar). I'm happy to follow this up with TwoFour but could you provide more information about how this would work?


5.       Do you have an update on making the home page lighbox/carousel work using the multi-programme view of the video?


6.       Plus the outstanding bug with videos being deleted from the CMS when we make a change to them in MF, which you are already investigating.

Phew - quite a lot there! Just wanted to capture all those points before I forget them! Let me know your thoughts when you have had time to consider.

Thanks!

Morag

Morag Reavley
New Media Manager
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
1 Churchill Place
Canary Wharf
London
Direct dial: 020 32012 160
Reception: 020 32012 000
